issue.title: [Python] conda-forge pyarrow package does not have s3 enabled
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7827](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7827). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
[conda-recipes/pyarrow\|[https://github.com/apache/arrow/tree/master/dev/tasks/conda-recipes/pyarrow]] has S3 and some others enabled, but [conda-forge/pyarrow/feedstock\|[https://github.com/conda-forge/pyarrow-feedstock/tree/master/recipe]] does not. It seems like `bld.bat` and `build.sh` in conda-forge feedstock are outdated.

comments.body:

I opened an issue here https://github.com/conda-forge/pyarrow-feedstock/issues/98. Do you want to open a PR to the feedstock?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7827?focusedCommentId=17057326) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Resolved by https://github.com/conda-forge/pyarrow-feedstock/commit/29fbc0d4a4aacb68a302e870c0f5c7751ca61ed4
